Summary: NC for 19.01 Isolated areas of unstable windslab on NW-NE aspects above 900m. Elsewhere stability mainly good, Hazard Moderate.
SnowDistribution: Winds approx 30-40mph making for tiring progress into the wind. Very hard snow ice on exposed windward slopes and breakable crust in many areas.  Cloudy on the tops with some bright spells.
Comment: Icy conditions remain on some of the lower mountain paths.
WeatherInfluences: Light snow fall during the evening above around 900 metres will clear to become dry and mostly sunny during the day. Continuing strong South-South-Easterly winds. The freezing level will rise above the summits during the day though much terrain will remain frozen above 600 metres.
SnowStability: Unstable windslab will be present on North-West to North-East aspects above 900 metres. Steep wind sheltered locations such as coire rims and gully exits and will be especially affected. Fragile cornices will overhang these aspects. Elsewhere the snowpack will be mostly well bonded and stable. The avalanche hazard will be Moderate.
ObservedWeatherInfluences:
A dry day with very strong South-South-Easterly winds. 
The freezing level was around 800 metres. Clear skies overnight with associated temperature inversion.
ObservedSnowStability: Fluctuating temperatures have helped improve the stability of the snowpack. However isolated accumulations of unstable windslab have developed on North-West to North-East aspects above 900 metres. Also, lingering instabilities persist in the older windslab on the same aspects. Areas especially affected are steep wind sheltered locations such as coire rims and gully exits. Fragile cornices overhang these aspects. The avalanche hazard is Moderate.

SnowDistribution: Reasonable cover above 700 metres. Generally good visibility but cloud hanging around the higher summits.  Winds 20 -30 mph.
Comment: Hard going on foot away from tracks above 700 metres altitude.
WeatherInfluences: Another generally dry day with near gale South-Easterly winds. The freezing level will slowly rise up to around 1100 metres by the end of the day.
SnowStability: The snowpack will continue to very slowly consolidate in the settled conditions. However, some instabilities will remain in the areas of windslab which will be present mainly on North-West through North to East aspects above 1000 metres. Below this level stability will be better. Some significant cornices will also remain present. The avalanche hazard will be Moderate
ObservedWeatherInfluences: A day day with moderate South-Easterly winds. The freezing level was around 1000 metres.
ObservedSnowStability: The snowpack is slowly consolidating. However, areas of moderately bonded windslab remain. These are generally found on  North-West through North to East aspects above 900 metres. Some significant cornices also exist. Below 900 metres stability is generally good. The avalanche hazard is Moderate

SnowDistribution: Diminishing snowpack, good above 800 metres.  Cloudy on the tops with some bright spells. Light but cold winds  on the tops.
Comment: The consolidating trend in the snowpack continues although it is soft and moist.
WeatherInfluences: On the summits, winds fresh to strong South-South-Easterly overnight and during the day. Freezing level around 900m rising to above the summits later in the day. It is expected to be dry throughout the forecast period.
SnowStability: The consolidating trend will continue to stabilise the snowpack in all areas. Greatest accumulations are present on North-West through North to Easterly aspects above 750m. Cornices overhang the same aspects with collapse potential.  The snowpack is firmer above 950m or so, below this level, although moist and soft the snowpack is also generally stable. Surface instabilities may be possible on any sun affected steep slopes. The avalanche hazard will be Low
ObservedWeatherInfluences: It has been a dry bright day with moderate strength South-Easterly winds on the tops. Freezing level around 950m.
ObservedSnowStability: Fluctuating freezing levels and a cold night have helped with the consolidating trend in the snowpack. Above 900m the snowpack is generally firmer, below this level it is  moist and soft and but also stable. Greatest amounts are above 750 on North-West through North to Easterly aspects. Cornice development is noted above same aspects. The avalanche hazard is Low

SnowDistribution: Diminishing snow cover below 650 metres deeper snow deposits above 800 metres.  No visibility throughout the day above 850 metres. South-Easterly winds were 15-20 mph over the higher summits.
Comment: The snowpack continues to consolidate in the Southerly air-stream.
WeatherInfluences: The freezing level with be around 1000 metres during Sunday night gradually rising to be above the summits by the end the period. Mainly dry with patchy clouds, winds will be moderate to fresh from a South-Easterly direction.
SnowStability: Stable conditions so again little change is expected. Deposits of unstable windslab will persist in steep wind sheltered locations on mainly North-West through North to East aspects above 950 metres. Greatest accumulations will be around coire rims, gully tops, ridge flanks and in sheltered hollows. Cornices will also be fragile on these aspects. Elsewhere the snowpack will continue to consolidate and be generally stable. The avalanche hazard will be Moderate.
ObservedWeatherInfluences: The freezing level was around 950 metres. A predominantly dry day, cloudy over the higher summits giving some white conditions particularly in the morning. Winds were South-Easterly generally moderate but fresh at times.
ObservedSnowStability: Some areas of poorly bonded windslab are still present in steep wind sheltered locations mainly on North-West through North to East aspects above 950 metres. Greatest accumulations are in sheltered hollows, coire rims, gully tops and some ridge flanks. Cornices are also present on these aspects. Elsewhere the snowpack has continued to consolidate and is generally stable. The avalanche hazard is Moderate.

SnowDistribution: A cold, clear and dry day.
Comment: Some light precipitation is possible during the afternoon but otherwise a dry day.
WeatherInfluences: It will be a mainly dry day with moderate South-Easterly winds. The freezing level will be around 800m rising to 1000m during the afternoon.
SnowStability: Localised areas of windslab will be present mainly on steep North-West, North and North-East aspects above 850m. Elsewhere the snowpack will be generally stable.  The avalanche hazard will be Moderate.
ObservedWeatherInfluences: It has been a dry day with the main freezing level around 800m but also with sub zero temperatures at lower elevations. Strengthening South-Easterly winds.
ObservedSnowStability: Localised areas of windslab are present, mainly on North-West, North and North-East aspects above 850m. Elsewhere the snowpack is mainly refrozen and stable especially on slopes out of the sun. The avalanche hazard is Moderate.

SnowDistribution: Icy paths and hillsides.  Cloud base was at 700 metres all day.  Winds 20-30 mph progress difficult at times with stronger gusts.
WeatherInfluences: Light snowfall for a short period this evening above 950 metres followed by a dry day. Freezing level lowering overnight to 750 metres before steadily climbing through the day to reach 1100 metres by mid-afternoon. Fresh, generally Southerly winds.
SnowStability: The recent snow will continue to consolidate in the fluctuating temperatures with the vast majority demonstrating good stability. Isolated pockets of deeper windslab will persist in steeper, wind sheltered locations on North-West to North-East aspects above 1000 metres. Surface layers will start to soften on all but the highest summits later in the day.  The avalanche hazard will be Low.
ObservedWeatherInfluences: A dry but cloudy morning. Very light precipitation arrived during the afternoon, falling as a trace of snow above 900 metres. Winds were fresh to strong South-South-Easterly. Freezing level around 900 metres at midday.
ObservedSnowStability: Recent windslab accumulations are consolidating and have developed a surface crust. Isolated pockets of deeper windslab are present in steeper, wind sheltered locations on North-West to North-East aspects above 1000 metres. Elsewhere the snow is generally well bonded. Softer and thawing at lower elevations. The avalanche hazard is Low.
